newsitem.title: UK: SHELL SAYS CAPEX SET TO RISE IN H2.
newsitem.headline: SHELL SAYS CAPEX SET TO RISE IN H2.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell Group said on Thursday that spending on capital expenditure and exploration is set to "step up" in the second half of the year, mainly in exploration and production.
The group said capital and expenditure expense in the first six months was 38 percent of the planned 8.2 billion stg for the full year.

The oil giant reported a four percent drop in second quarter profits, reflecting the recent strength of sterling. Net earnings excluding special items were 1.14 billion stg for the quarter, making 2.69 billion for the half year.
Royal Dutch/Shell Group is 60 percent owned by Royal Dutch Petroleum Co of the Netherlands and 40 percent by Britain's Shell Transport and Trading Co Plc.
